reviews.text: Very beautiful. I really love china. The view, the place, the people, very lovely
Must to be! And go to upstairs.... to Beauty Peak!

Residence of the local prince during the Ming dynasty (a great nephew of the first emperor of Ming). Fairly elaborate grounds. There was also a mock Imperial exam for the tourist groups, which was a hoot (especially for those who can't read Chinese).
Historical site, but terribly destroyed during centuries, now it is sterile, uninteresting. Not worth to money  (120CNY entrance fee). Only one plus point is climb to Solitary Beauty Peak.
Not much to see inside.
This museum is not open. It looks like it's under renovation.
One of the best museum I've ever visited. Highly recommended for people that looking for a great sightseeing around👌
Good
宏偉

The park itself is fine, OK to visit, ticket isn't too expensive, but need another different tickets for here and there, the famous CAVE is one of them, need an extra ticket to enter.

The pavilion on top of the middle small hill is not that worth it after reach it, not well maintained and not very clean, either. The view for surrounding terrains are just fine.
Really fun to visit. The mountain has beautiful view. Also, there are walls in which you can learn history.

Used to come here often as a kid, but the scenery inside is not worth the entrance price. The highlight for me are the several hills inside the park that can be easily hiked for good views of the city, a hill shaped like a camel where Bill Clinton gave a speech, and a mosque and several modest Buddhist temples, but they may have renovated and gone commercial. Qixing Cave can be skipped if you see Reed Flute Cave. 

If you are put off by the ticket price, there are a few places where the park fence intersect the river where one could sneak in for free, just watch for poop along the path.

Nice park in Guilin, you could climb up a mountain inside the park to get a great view of the city and surrounding mountains. Had some beautiful sculptures and nice amenities. The high ropes course is cool, but much more suited to kids than adults as we found out the hard way 😂

A nice Park right in the centre of Guilin. The view from the star pavilion is great. We met a monk praying at the top of the mountain,  saw some monkeys and took a photo in ethnic costumes in front of camel Hill. All in all a very relaxing way to spend an afternoon
Wonderfully scenic & surprisingly clean despite some Chinese "landmine laying" and children relieving themselves wherever/ whenever culture from domestic tourist.

The mountain was exciting and you get very nice views from the top. The most awe inspiring thing where the Buddhist Carvings in the Trunk of the Elephant. They where used to 'print' Scrolls in ancient times. Also a general note about Guilin: you HAVE to try Guilin Tea. Its made from the Blossom of a local tree. Probably my favourite Tea in the world. It has slight fruity hints of peach.
The environmental management here is very good. I really appreciate. I love this city.
Elephant Trunk Hill in Guilin, great light show at night.
Boat ride along the river was ordinary. Nothing outstanding.

A nice experience. It's about a 30 minute slow walk through the cave. The air is cool and the floors are wet and slippery.  Take your water bottle and wear good walking shoes. I went with a tour group and they had a short movie playing across the limestone walls/ceiling. There's also a photo booth within the cave where you can get your photo taken by the cave photographer and printed out. The cave guide spoke good English and pointed out limestones formed like snowman, Christmas trees, local vegetables, mushrooms, etc.

I came to Guilin and went to the Reed Flute Cave at the end of October 2018. When I arrived at the bus location, I had to park at the parking location located below. We can climb up on foot or take the train. The Reed Flute Cave is a cave that is formed naturally but requires a very long time. The view of the stone in the cave is given a very beautiful colorful lights. The air outside and inside the cave is very cool. We have to go up and down stairs to walk down the cave. Then prepare yourself and maybe be able to bring water in a bottle because the cave that must be passed is quite long. Inside also at certain times there is a short film projected onto the rock and very good. If we come there with a local guide, they can tell fairy tales about stones that can resemble several shapes.

Amazing experience here. But it IS a tourist spot so there will be many people trying to sell you things. My group was also given a coupon where we can choose a oyster and get its pearl. If the pearl is not deformed, then you just have to pay RMB 30 to make it into a necklace.
Beautiful. Must visit. Would be 5 but personally I didn't really like quite so much colourful lighting inside the caves. Good for photos though!

Reed Flute Cave known as “the Palace of Natural Arts” is located in the northwest of Guilin in southern China. According to a legend, Reed Flute Cave got its name because people believed that the reed by the cave’s mouth could be made into flutes. The limestone cave offers a majestic fairyland of stalactites, stalagmites, stone pillars, stone curtains, birds, plants and animals in fantastic shapes and colors.

Really wanted to enjoy this place but in my opinion, the natural beauty has been spoiled by tourism and the hunt to squeeze as much money as possible out of the experience. The cave is interesting enough inside, but the tour is heavily controlled and rushed. And even though you're inside a cave, there are still various vendors jockeying for your attention.
this is one of the best caves we have had visited. Come, you will nit be disappointed.
Mesmerizing and mysterious.... And wonderful
這裡出景區後，先別搭電瓶車下山，可以往電瓶車反方向走，延著樓梯往下走到灕江，途中會結果舊南門口，再來就是港口，可以欣賞灕江風景，觀賞冠岩暗河出水洞口，也可以考慮在此搭竹筏回停車場。
風景很美
